label: 酒屋土倉
本: Terms and Concepts in Japanese Medieval History . Journal of Japanese Studies . 1983
説明文: Sake brewers who used capital for financing other operations such as moneylending; they often became objects of special taxation by great religious institutions like Enryakuji, by aristocratic families, and by the Muromachi bakufu. In Kyoto, sakaya and dosō were often, though not always, one and the same institution, and are usually referred to as such. See dosō.　[延暦寺、土倉]
